page.title: 09LIFE ON ST.MICHAEL'S MOUNT
page.content: People on the Mount are employed working as staff or guides in the castle and grounds. Some are boatmen who take people across to the mainland at high tide. The children who live on the Mount have a room to meet in and a tennis court. On the harbour is a National Trust shop, a cinema for slide shows and a cafe for the many people who walk across the causeway to visit the Mount and the castle. There is a piped water supply from the mainland and a well of fresh water which is still used if there is a water shortage. The Mount is a Coastguard Station. A tunnel with an underground railway runs from the harbour to the castle and is used to take food, stores, etc. up to the castle.
